intro: Agelanthus kayseri, commonly known as the Kayseri agelanthus, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. It is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
